reason: MISSING INVOLUTION RULE: The claim that '(1+x)*(1+x) is self-adjoint' requires showing ((1+x)*(1+x))* = (1+x)*(1+x). This requires the involution identity (ab)* = b*a* (anti-homomorphism property). This fundamental property of *-algebras must be explicitly stated as an external reference or assumption. Without it, we cannot even begin to verify self-adjointness of products.
